title.narrative: SWE-2012-092: Effects of a low toxicity pesticide in an intercrop system
SWE-2012-092: Effects of a low toxicity pesticide in an intercrop system

description.narrative: Potato and tomato are of major importance in Ethiopia. Still severe pest problems exist in current cultivation systems and high resource input is needed. This field study for integrated and sustainable pest and disease control has three objectives: (1) To monitor the effects of early blight (Alternaria ssp.), late blight (Phytophthora infestans) and potato tuber moth (Phthorimaea operculella) when using a novel potato-tomato intercropping system (2) To investigate the effects of application of phosphite potassium, which is a fungicide and plant resistance-inducer of very low toxicity in the above mentioned intercropping system as well as in monocultures (3) To generate Next Generation Sequencing data to compare plant defence responses in plants grown in the different systems. One objective is knowledge transfer of recent techniques for plant-pathogen interactions and plant breeding.

Potato and tomato are of major importance in Ethiopia. Still severe pest problems exist in current cultivation systems and high resource input is needed. This field study for integrated and sustainable pest and disease control has three objectives: (1) To monitor the effects of early blight (Alternaria ssp.), late blight (Phytophthora infestans) and potato tuber moth (Phthorimaea operculella) when using a novel potato-tomato intercropping system (2) To investigate the effects of application of phosphite potassium, which is a fungicide and plant resistance-inducer of very low toxicity in the above mentioned intercropping system as well as in monocultures (3) To generate Next Generation Sequencing data to compare plant defence responses in plants grown in the different systems. One objective is knowledge transfer of recent techniques for plant-pathogen interactions and plant breeding.
